File libsrc/libmath/xcorr_lag.c

Public Functions

xcorr_lag 
 int xcorr_lag(float *x,
               int nx,
               double fx,
               float *y,
               int ny,
               double fy,
               double *rmax)
Compute maximum cross-correlation and time lag.

Returns lag of array y relative to x that yields the best cross-correlation. Only lags that allow inclusion of all points in the shorter array are considered.

Parameters:
x - array of nx values.
nx - number of values in x.
fx - x scaling factor. x will be multiplied by fx.
y - array of ny values.
ny - number of values in y.
fy - y scaling factor. y will be multiplied by fy.
rmax - returned maximum correlation coefficient.
Returns:
the lag (shift) of array y relative to array x.
